intro: Spiropetalum erythrocarpum, commonly known as the red-fruited spiraling bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, spiral-arranged flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Spiropetalum erythrocarpum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
